channel.title: Quanity of item in shops! Please help Rep++!
channel.description:
Catch up to what has been said so far: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,523714.0.html
Okay, so I have items in my shop and they are set to the quanity of 1000 each.
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/xekenm.png[/img]
How do I remove the 0 for the quanity # in my shops?
I would like there to be [u][b]no[/b][/u] number. Just the item.
Like this... [IMG]http://i42.tinypic.com/nwy9w5.png[/img]
Rep++ for any help!

item.title: Quanity of item in shops! Please help Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

^I was talking to guthix, he doesn’t know what he is talking about.

Read full topic

item.title: Quanity of item in shops! Please help Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:15, topic:421061”][quote author=guthix1pker link=topic=523735.msg3812983#msg3812983 date=1321092557]

Um there is no infinity symbol in java dumbass

um there is a infinity symbol in java dumbass

just try it and you’ll see i have it in my shops.
[/quote]
You don’t know an ounce of java… do you? If the inf. symbol is in java, what is it’s type? int? char?[/quote]

Are you talking to me, or guthix on that quote?

and my problem is still not solved

Read full topic

[/quote]

um there is a infinity symbol in java dumbass

just try it and you’ll see i have it in my shops.[/quote]

item.title: Quanity of item in shops! Please help Rep++!
item.dc:creator: @JGX JGX
item.description:
@JGX wrote:

baddy351:

That just makes it so it shows an infinity symbol. You can show it, but an infinity symbol may be counted as a char data type, but nothing else.

So I can’t use that… well I guess there is no way to fix my issue…

Read full topic

Um there is no infinity symbol in java dumbass
[/quote]

um there is a infinity symbol in java dumbass

just try it and you’ll see i have it in my shops.[/quote]

There is?

What is it?

it can’t be the ATL + # code because that would void the whole file.

This is the only thing I found so far on the Java infinity symbol.

ActiveSheet.Range("A1").Value = ChrW(&h221E)
